critique: This executive order focuses on water pollution control from Federal Government activities. It mandates pollution control plans for existing and new federal facilities, sets general standards for waste treatment, and encourages cooperation with state and local agencies. It also requires consideration of water pollution control in federal water resource projects and reviews of loan, grant, and contract practices. There is nothing about immigration, civil liberties, or ideological tilt. The order expands federal oversight of water quality, which could be seen as an expansion of executive power and federalism. It also involves government intervention in economic regulation through pollution control standards and promotes social inclusion by protecting water quality for all.
